byline.contributor: Sadi Niyungeko reported from Bujumbura, and Dan Bilefsky from London. Isma’il Kushkush contributed reporting from Kigali, Rwanda, and Rick Gladstone from New York.
byline.original: By SADI NIYUNGEKO and DAN BILEFSKY

abstract: Burundi government says coup attempt has been crushed by loyalist army and police officers, ending two days of confusion over who was in control of country; Pres Pierre Nkurunziza, whose decision to seek third term sparked violent protests, thanks army and police; it is not clear how extensive plot to overthrow Nkurunziza was, and how it was stopped also remains unclear.
lead_paragraph: It was by no means clear that stability would soon return to Burundi, which has suffered a long history of upheavals.

headline.main: Burundi Government Says It Has Crushed Coup Attempt
headline.print_headline: Burundi’s Government Declares That Coup Attempt Has Been Crushed

snippet: It was by no means clear that stability would soon return to Burundi, which has suffered a long history of upheavals.

keywords.value: Coups D'Etat and Attempted Coups D'Etat
